page.title: 13GRAND UNION CANAL OFFCHURCH
page.content: { Today,}the vast majority of boats seen on the canal are{pleasure boats. However, on occasion, coal carrying barges can be seen. The canal between {Bascote Locks and Offchurch,}passes through fields of{rape, wheat and {hay,}with occasional{period houses. Two of the three{bridges}spanning the canal have been modernised and are now of{re-inforced concrete, whereas the bridge close to{Bascote {Lock}retains its old world charm of {red brick. At{Bascote}are three locks. Some of the lock gate beams are of original oak or elm though others are now of iron. {West of Bascote,}the canal widens at a{winding point}where boats may turn. Near{Fosse Rd Bridge}is a{water {point}where boats may take on up to 125 gallons of water.
